Salary: $862 per day (inclusive of super or plus GST)
Ad Text:
Our client is a large NSW government department that provides extensive education services

They are at the forefront of digital reinvention; leveraging artificial intelligence to revolutionise education

Role Description:

The Senior AI Officer will support the Department’s AI governance and assurance activities by supporting the review and assessment of Artificial Intelligence Assessment Framework (AIAF) submissions.

The role focuses on ensuring AI initiatives are assessed consistently, proportionately and in line with NSW Government requirements; providing clear advice to decision makers and supporting safe, ethical and compliant AI adoption across the Department

This role does not deliver AI solutions; it provides assurance, risk assessment and expert advice.

Responsibilities:

Review Artificial Intelligence Assessment Framework (AIAF) submissions for completeness, quality and alignment with NSW Government requirements.
Assess AI initiatives against AIAF risk domains, working with the SME panel on ethics, fairness, privacy, security, transparency and accountability
Identify gaps, inconsistencies and risk issues - providing clear, actionable feedback to submitters.
Assess risk ratings and recommended assurance pathways based on scale, context and impact
Support the refinement of intake practices, systems and procedures to streamline AI requests and improve the quality of information 
Contribute to briefings, reports and summaries for governance forums and senior decision-makers.
Ensure alignment of AIAF assessments with the Digital Assurance Framework (DAF), NSW AI Ethics Principles, and relevant SMEs in privacy, cyber security and data.
Support consistent application of AI governance across corporate and school-based initiatives
Maintain alignment between AI risk management, departmental strategy and emerging AI opportunities
Skills and Experience

Essential

Demonstrated experience reviewing or assuring AI systems, digital solutions or data driven technologies.
Experience applying governance or assurance frameworks in a complex organisation or government environment.
Ability to assess technical and non-technical risks and communicate clearly with non specialist audiences
Strong written and verbal communication / documentation skills
Proven ability to liaise with technical and business stakeholders
Desirable

Familiarity with the NSW AIAF, DAF or equivalent government frameworks.
Experience with privacy impact assessments or technology assurance processes.
Understanding of AI use in education or public sector service delivery contexts
 Consultant: Colin Massey

Keywords: Artificial Intelligence, AI, NSW government, education, Artificial Intelligence Assessment Framework (AIAF), Digital Assurance Framework (DAF), NSW AI Ethics Principles, assurance, risk assessment, governance
